triples.name: Logistic regression
triples.relevance: One of the supervised machine learning algorithms used for heart disease prediction in the study.

triples.name: Decision tree learning
triples.relevance: A supervised learning algorithm applied to build predictive models for heart disease classification.

triples.name: Support vector machine
triples.relevance: A classification algorithm used alongside other methods to demonstrate accuracy in heart disease prediction.

triples.name: K-nearest neighbors algorithm
triples.relevance: A supervised learning method employed for heart disease prediction among the tested classification algorithms.

triples.name: Naive Bayes classifier
triples.relevance: A probabilistic classifier used in the study to compare performance with other machine learning algorithms.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The core field of study used in the paper for disease prediction and risk identification in healthcare.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: The fundamental classification task addressed using multiple supervised machine learning algorithms.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: Reference to the UCI data repository that provided the 1025-sample dataset used in the study.

triples.name: Cardiovascular disease
triples.relevance: Heart disease is a form of cardiovascular disease that the paper aims to predict using machine learning.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a practical application of supervised learning models for heart disease prediction and demonstrates their comparative accuracy.
